title: The reason why I think Zed is an...unhealthy champion
body:
Hes got some good harass in lane and some good all in. That's cool.

The real problem, is the FAILSAFES.

No matter HOW badly zed fucks up, now matter how much he gets caught, he can just R or W for an instant escape unharmed.

If you don't have someone camping his shadow, (Which you shouldn't, thats 1 team member out of the fight) He will get out 100%. Unless you are a dumb zed and don't lead them between attacks and stand still, you can be in three places at once.

Where you are now, where you will be if you E, and where you will be when you R.

That is RIDICULOUS presence with an assassin. Leblanc had the same power, but in response they cut her silence so you can do something about it.

But zed still has EXTENDED untargetability. He got an extra .5 seconds of untargetability later after release, meaning he can dodge more damage, and follow you if you dash, flash, or whatever it may be. He can pursue, destroy, then blink away.

That's not good, Assassin's have an all in, and some form of safety, but the safety only lasts so long and there is a way to rid it.

For instance, Akali has her cloak, but it only lasts so long and can be negated by a pink ward.

Unless you CC Zed for a SIX SECONDS, which is TWICE as long as it takes for the mark to trigger, than he will get away.

The second thing, is that he can build nothing but tank shred, and still have more than enough damage to KO a squishy.

This is partially because tank shredding items are a bit too strong, but also because he has RIDICULOUS scaling and base damage.

BC, LW, and BOTRK for tank shredding, but i'm not a tank so that shouldn't do anything to me right? WRONG. He will scale off the slightest AD, and for some reason BOTRK actives APPLIES to his mark, dealing another half an active upon trigger, and his base damage is so sky high that without decent AD he still has massive damage to kill a 2k health carry.

This is why I think he is an unhealthy champion, no other champion in the game can build nothing but tank shred and KO a carry, then get out whenever he wants no matter how bad he fucks up.

Let's be honest, would you rather play against a fed Fizz who is a global threat to your team or a fed Zed who in actuality is only going to be assassinating one member of your team and that's if you give that member no form of self-peel and he doesn't give himself any.

When choosing between those two? Definitely against Fizz than Zed. Fizz can be stopped much easier than Zed due to:

* No blinks. Fizz Q and E are dashes and as such can be stopped by well timed CC, Veigar Event Horizon, Azir wall (Fizz can't get over it).
* Safety based on delaying and waiting, not by blinking out. When he uses E/Zhonya, he'll become vulnerable again as soon as trollpole/Zhonya ends, therefore giving time to delete him.
* No ranged abilities outside long CD ultimate. Fizz has to all-in, he has no ranged poke.
* Much slower burst. Fizz can't get in, burst, get out and wait until you die, he needs to land 2-3 AAs to secure a kill. Zed can execute his entire combo in less than 1 second, blinking twice in this time.
* Vulnerable to anti-divers. As above, Zed is one of safest divers and anti-turtle champions, Fizz under tower will be deleted with any kind of CC.
* No sustain on Fizz side. Zed almost always has BoRK, giving him sustain, also he has energy. Fizz is mana-constrained and usually has no lifesteal/spellvamp, delaying him and making him waste mana (poke hard from range) will end with harmless Fizz.
* Escape range. Fizz can jump up to 800 range in about 0.5 second, which allow you to follow him and burst even if he tries to get in-burst-get out immediately. Zed can go (by backing to ult shadow and then using W to increase gap) 1175 units in about 0.1 second.
* Waveclear and turtling is extremely efficient against Fizz. He'll get low on mana when he tries to push and need to handle wave after wave. Half HP Zed dealing with wave after wave will soon get to full health and energy, then dive and kill you.

TBH I don't play Fizz a lot, he's a champion which can be countered by strategy and playstyle, not only by mechanics, items and summoners (as with Zed/Katarina). Zed is extremely efficient in any situation, Fizz can be outplayed and made useless quite easily.

Those assassins are unhealthy in different ways. They represent the old philosophy on assassins which was that they would be vulnerable in lane so they could be shut down. They had strategic counterplay.

The philosphy behind Zed is that he's not vulnerable in lane and he has a lot of fallback in his split pushing, but you can ruin his assassination attempts so you don't have to rely on strategic shutdown.

However, Zed's design fails because he is so incredibly safe in everything he does, and even when you stop him from killing somebody you've had to invest more resources (summoners, active items) than he had to invest. Because his engage is so reliable and safe he forces these exchanges to happen where he is guaranteed to invest less.

Overall you do not have any good strategic options against Zed. This is the most insidious kind of unhealthy design because so many players are fooled into thinking it's healthy, because they think they have good options against him. But in fact he brings huge strategic advantages to his team.

This is why Zed is superior to Talon in every situation now that Talon lost his silence. He needs something to create a small window of safety since Talon has no reliable escape (his ult should not be a defensive ult). I wish Rito could understand this...
Talon is actually better than Zed at numerous things. Faster burst, MUCH higher aoe damage. His winrate reflects this.

I still find Talon to be pretty good. The thing with Zed is that while he has huge damage potential, his kit is mechanically difficult; his Q and E are skillshots/AOEs that can miss, for example. Talon, on the other hand, is relatively easy to dump on enemies with. His one skillshot has a wide hitbox, and his ult AoE can be closed back up on command, making it more likely to hit.

And I see little issue with using his ult defensively if needed, though I like using it more like Shaco's invisibility (pop ult, go into the lane, E on the enemy champion, watch the damage fly).

Again - the "uselessness" of Talon with his lack of silence is only relevant if the enemies he targets are ALWAYS in possession of an escape mecahnism EVERY SINGLE FRIGGIN TIME he moves in to attack. Take Flash, for example - it can have a 210-300sec CD (assuming points in the Utility tree for decreased Summoner Spell cooldown AND the Distortion boot enchant). Talon's E has an 18-10sec CD (down to 6 with max CDR). Unless his opponents reserve every form of escape they have for Talon (and suffer the potential CC of the other 1-4 members of his team), then there are ample opportunities for Talon to jump on and wreck face, in regards to Flash's availability.

TL,DR: Both Talon and Zed are good in their own way. Zed may do higher damage in the late game, but is harder to get the hang of and a bit more prone to missing with his abilities than Talon. Both can wreck lane or be wrecked depending on their own performance and that of their opposing/allied teams. Both are also fairly squishy. :P
